newsitem.title: USA: ABC Inc president wary of free TV time.
newsitem.headline: ABC Inc president wary of free TV time.

text.p: ABC Inc President Robert Iger said Thursday he is wary of agreeing to President Clinton's call for broadcasters to give free air time to political candidates.
"We're not sure if we can be part of the solution," Iger said. "Limiting campaign spending is not an issue we can solve and there are complex legal issues that must be resolved."
Iger's remarks came in an address to the Association of National Advertisers Inc's annual television advertising forum.
Clinton's appeal is part of a recent push for campaign finance reform. He has said that free television time would reduce the effect of money on U.S. campaigns.
Clinton has proposed linking free air time for candidates to licenses for high-definition digital television.
Iger also said that he doubts that free television time would improve the caliber of candidates, political debates or discussions.
"I firmly believe free air time is not going to solve that problem," he said.
ABC is a division of Walt Disney Co.
((-- Lisa Marie Pane, New York newsdesk, 212 859-1713))
